result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Robert Paxton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:36 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jason Robert Paxton in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Jason Robert Paxton.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Becker recites joint agreement, requesting 60 days to review restitution.  Atty Schutte states DE is waiving PH.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Forgery  in 22CF206. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF206.  Court waives PSI.  Sentencing arguments.  DE to pay $100 today for Attorney fees, once paid warrant will be quashed.  DE to continue making payments towards attorney fees. No credit for time served. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF206

S/W 2 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $268.00   
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
  Balance to be pd through probation

- No Contact with Cole Johnston or business Jwood Sports Flooring

- Maintain sobriety
- DE not to possess any identifying information that does not belong to him
- DE not to possess checks that do not belong to him
- 2 months county jail- STAYED 
- Probation can be transferred, sign up for probation today, 8/23/22. 
- Pay supervision fees

03:10 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DE: Jason Robert Paxton pro se.  Court reviews file, DE does NOT qualify for PD.  DE does have PFAC, Court will appoint an attorney. Court advises DE next hearing is subject to change depending on attorney.  DE confirms address and updates phone number.  Adjourned at 3:14 PM. DE called stating does not qualify for a PD. Advised DE to fill out a PFAC. Clerk to mail PFAC to DE. Clerk transfered call to JA as DE has a PH 06/22. arc
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cole J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

No use or possession of identifying information or transactional materials that do not belong to Defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
